result.execSummary:
The defendant Terrance L Taylor was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possess w/Intent-Heroin(>3-10g) [Modifiers: Party to a Crime], a class E felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1m)(d)2.
  • Possess w/Intent-Cocaine (>1-5g) [Modifiers: Party to a Crime], a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1m)(cm)1r.

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Defendant Terrance L Taylor in court with attorney Michael L. Chernin.  Nicholas Steven Cerwin appeared for the State of Wisconsin./ SAB
  Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant.  
  The Court ordered the Defendant to:
AS TO COUNT 1:
-Serve 9 months in the House of Correction, consecutive to any other sentence and consecutive to Count 2,  with credit for 5 days time served.  Huber privileges pursuant to Sec. 303.08 Wis. Stats to apply`for work.
-Court costs and victim/witness surcharges are to be paid by 7/7/2018; nonpayment penalty shall be a civil judgment
-Defendant is to provide a DNA sample and pay related surcharge by 7/7/2018; nonpayment penalty shall be a civil judgment
-Restitution set at zero
-No drivers license suspension
AS TO COUNT 2:
Serve 6 months in the House of Correction, consecutive to any other sentence and consecutive to Count 1,  with credit for 0 days time served.  Huber privileges pursuant to Sec. 303.08 Wis. Stats to apply`for work.
-Court costs and victim/witness surcharges are to be paid by 7/7/2018; nonpayment penalty shall be a civil judgment
-Defendant is to provide a DNA sample and pay related surcharge by 7/7/2018; nonpayment penalty shall be a civil judgment
-Restitution set at zero
-No drivers license suspension
Court advised the defendant that as a convicted felon he may no longer use or possess any firearms; also he may not vote in any election until his civil rights have been restored.
Filed, Ineligible Voting Notice and Acknowledgement
Filed, Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief

Defendant Terrance L Taylor in court with attorney Michael L. Chernin.  Nicholas Steven Cerwin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Scheduling conference scheduled for June 12, 2015 at 01:30 pm.  COURT WILL RETAIN FILE.

Defendant Terrance L Taylor in court with attorney Michael L. Chernin.  Nicholas Steven Cerwin appeared for the State of Wisconsin. CMC. Parties have reached an agreement. As to the Second Amended Information:

AS TO COUNTS 1 AND 2
Defendant advised that if he is not a US citizen deportation is possible. Defendant changes plea to GUILTY. Defendant examined as to his plea, advised of his Constitutional rights and the maximum penalty. Court found that defendant freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived his rights. Plea questionnaire, Addendum, and Jury Instructions/Elements received and filed. Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea. Court found defendant guilty as charged in the information and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record. Defendant is advised he is a convicted felon and may not possess any firearms; also defendant is advised he is unable to vote in any election until his civil rights are restored.

AS TO COUNTS 3
Pursuant to plea negotiations, on motion of the state, court ordered Count 3 Dismissed, But Read In.

Case adjourned to branch 15 for Sentencing.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for July 1, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

records.addlTxt:
Amended Information previously received and filed.  Defense acknowledges receipt of a copy of the Amended Information, waives reading and enters a plea of not guilty to all counts.  Court AMENDS the charges to Count 1) Possession with Intent to Deliver Controlled Substance (Heroin) (>3-10 grams) 961.41(1m)(d)2 a Class E felony; Count 2) Possesion with Intent to Deliver Cocaine (<=5G) 961.41(1m)(cm)1r a Class F Felony; Count 3) Possession with Intent to Deliver Controlled Substance (THC) (200 Grams or Less/4Plants of Less) 961.41(1m)(h)1 a Class I Felony.

Case remains set for jury trial.
